abstract: Photographs by Jill Freedman, who sought out strange people and scenes in New York City's diverse neighborhoods from mid-1960s to 1980s, will go on view at Steven Kasher Gallery in Chelsea in October; Freedman laments changes she feels have since driven out the true character of New York City.
lead_paragraph: Jill Freedman photographed the hidden New York: “beggars, panhandlers, people sleeping on the street.”

headline.main: For a Street Photographer, ‘The Weirder, the Better’

snippet: Jill Freedman photographed the hidden New York: “beggars, panhandlers, people sleeping on the street.”
